ngiemboon: Á tǎa ńgwɔ́ tsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ, e Ssé gɔɔn né Yakwɔ̂b ngie: «Pʉʉ, ńgʉa ńnéŋe Mbetɛɛ! Ɔ̀ ge kúu wó, é kwɛ́ɛ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, é náa mbwó Ssé gie e la kẅɛɛ mvfò gù wó, á fʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ la ne ńkÿo fɛ̌ gù Ezagẅi.»
en: God said to Jacob, “Get up! Go to Bethel and settle there.   Build an altar there to the God who appeared to you when you fled from your brother Esau.”  # 35:1 Gn 27:43

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b gɔɔn mbwó pʉ̀a tsìŋendá yé tà mbɔɔ mbwó pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ̌ la gwɔ́ ngie: «Pi gwáʼ messé ndyɛ̀ʼɛ mie ée mendá pi. Pi sɔg menò tepòŋ na pi, ńgwɔ́ ndʉalʉ̌a, ńkúbe menzsǒ mí.
en: So Jacob said to his family and all who were with him, “Get rid of the foreign gods that are among you.   Purify yourselves and change your clothes.  # 35:2 Ex 19:10

ngiemboon: Pege ge pʉ né Mbetɛɛ, n ge kúu wó, é pwóon jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, é náa mbwó Ssé gie e ka júʼu sẅíŋtè yɔ́ɔn, á fʉ̀ʼ gie n kaa tsɛ̀ɛ cʉanò. À ka tóonte wɔ́ɔn, á na legìŋ gẅie n ka gÿo.»
en: We must get up and go to Bethel. I will build an altar there to the God who answered me in my day of distress.   He has been with me everywhere I have gone.”  # 35:3 Gn 28:10–22

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, pɔ́ pú ńkate messé ndyɛ̀ʼɛ mie pɔ́ la gẅiin, ḿbú ńnáa mbwó Yakwɔ̂b, tà mbɔɔ mekwáŋ metuŋó. Á ffo tsìŋe tÿǒ gʉ́m gie áa ngʉ̀ŋe Sishÿɛ̂m.
en: Then they gave Jacob all their foreign gods and their earrings, and Jacob hid them under the oak near Shechem.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b pâ penkʉ́ pé la gwaa fó jʉʼó gʉa, máamáa shʉ́shÿɔ́g Ssé pú ńgwoon pʉ̀a pie é tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mie é kéle jʉʼó. Tà nyìŋ te gẅiin shÿɔ̀g léjwoŋte wɔ́b wɔ́.
en: When they set out, a terror from God came over the cities around them, and they did not pursue Jacob’s sons.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b pâ pʉ̀a pie pâ pɔ̌ la gwɔ́ la gʉa tà ńkúu Lûuzè gẅie mé gíŋe ńtóŋ lê Mbetɛɛ, á gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Kánàhan.
en: So Jacob and all who were with him came to Luz (that is, Bethel  ) in the land of Canaan.

ngiemboon: Ńkúu wó, ńkwɛ́ɛ jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ, ńtóŋ lezíŋ jʉʼó lê Ɛɛ-Mbetɛɛ (ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie e «Ssé Mbetɛɛ»), ńtí páʼ á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie à la ne ńkÿo fɛ̌ we, e Ssé kẅɛɛ mvfò yé jʉʼó ŋwɛ́.
en: Jacob built an altar there and called the place El-bethel   because it was there that God had revealed himself to him when he was fleeing from his brother.

ngiemboon: Ndebóla gẅie à laa mátsáb Lɛpékà la kwé, mé túŋo yé ngʉ̀ŋe Mbetɛɛ á tsìŋe tsɔ́ tÿǒ gie á fáŋ, lezíŋ gwɔ́ lê shÿɛ̂n, mbà mé la tsẅi lezíŋ yɛ̌ tÿǒ lê tÿǒ lelʉ̀a.
en: Deborah, the one who had nursed and raised Rebekah,  ,# 35:8 Gn 24:59 died and was buried under the oak south of Bethel. So Jacob named it Allon-bacuth.  # 35:8 = Oak of Weeping

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie Yakwɔ̂b la fó kwòŋo Alam ḿbiŋ, e Ssé gíŋe ńkẅɛɛ mvfò yé, ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè na yé.
en: God appeared to Jacob again after he returned from Paddan-aram, and he blessed him.

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Lezíŋ shú ée lê Yakwɔ̂b, táʼ mé té gíŋe tóŋo gú púʼu wɔ́, mé ge cʉ́ʼ tóŋo gú pɔ́ lê Ésàlayɛ.»
en: God said to him, “Your name is Jacob; you will no longer be named Jacob, but your name will be Israel.”   So he named him Israel.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gɔɔn né yé ngie: «N gee Ssé gie e pǔ ńgẅiin ngʉ̀ʼ, zyé mboŋó, ngẅɛ̀ jù zyéen. Tàʼ ngwòŋ, ńgÿo tàʼ nùɔ mengwòŋ, ge láʼ fó na gù. Ɔ̀ piŋ ńzyé mefùɔ.
en: God also said to him, “I am God Almighty.   Be fruitful and multiply.  # 35:11 Gn 9:1,7 A nation, indeed an assembly of nations, will come from you,  # 35:11 Gn 48:4 and kings will descend from you.  # 35:11 Lit will come from your loins,# 35:11 Gn 17:6,16; 36:31

ngiemboon: Ngwòŋ gẅie n da náa mbwó Ábalaham pɔ́ Ésàg, n nǎ né gù mbɔɔ né ngẅɛ̀ jú tà mbɔɔ fʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ te láʼ gíŋe gwɔ́ wó wɔ́.»
en: I will give to you the land that I gave to Abraham and Isaac.   And I will give the land to your future descendants.”

ngiemboon: E Ssé fó jʉʼ gie à gɔ̌ɔn nò né Yakwɔ̂b wó, ḿbʉ.
en: Then God withdrew  ,# 35:13 Gn 17:22; 18:33 from him at the place where he had spoken to him.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b líe tóon jʉʼó, ḿbʉʼʉ ńtÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g, ḿpfɛte shúm pwɔʼ ndumó: é melùʼ pɔ́ mevɛ́.
en: Jacob set up a marker at the place where he had spoken to him #— #a stone marker. He poured a drink offering on it and poured oil on it.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b tsẅi lezíŋ yɛ̌ jʉʼ gie Ssé la gɔɔn nò né yé wó lê Mbetɛɛ.
en: Jacob named the place where God had spoken with him Bethel.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b pâ pʉ̀a pé la fó Mbetɛɛ ńgʉa tà ńkúu tsɔ́ jʉʼ, tà lefǒ yɛ̌ jʉʼ, ńkúu Efalata, ntyě nyé sag, Lǎshÿɛ̂ zyé. Ńgwaa zyé, ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ tɛʼ.
en: They set out from Bethel. When they were still some distance from Ephrath, Rachel began to give birth, and her labor was difficult.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ gie Lǎshÿɛ̂ la gíŋe ḿbú ne ńgyá ngɔ́ʼ lezyé ŋwɛ́, mánkẅè gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Te gíŋe ḿbɔ́g, ɔ̀ gǐŋ ńzyé tàʼ múɔ mbàŋa.»
en: During her difficult labor, the midwife said to her, “Don’t be afraid, for you have another son.”

ngiemboon: Páʼ Lǎshÿɛ̂ la cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ncwò legwé la, á gwaa cʉ́m, ńtsẅi lezíŋ múɔ lê Mbɛŋ-Oni, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie: «Múɔ ngʉ̀ngʉ̀». Táʼ, tá múɔ tsẅi sé yé lê Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ, «Múɔ gẅie aa pwó tʉ̀ yɔ́ɔn».
en: With her last breath #— #for she was dying #— #she named him Ben-oni,   but his father called him Benjamin.  # 35:18 = Son of the Right Hand

ngiemboon: Lǎshÿɛ̂ kwé, mé túŋo yé ngʉ̀ŋe mánzsè Efalata gẅie mé ée fʉ̀ʼɔɔn ńtóŋ lê Mbɛ́tèlehɛm.
en: So Rachel died and was buried on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem  ).

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b líe tóon, ḿbʉʼʉ ńtÿɔ́gɔ na lesyè Lǎshÿɛ̂. Tóon ŋwɛ́ gǐŋ ńtyé pɔ́ na lesyè Lǎshÿɛ̂ tà ńkú lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn.
en: Jacob set up a marker on her grave; it is the marker at Rachel’s grave still today.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b gʉa tà ńtɔ́gɔ Migdá-Endɛ̂ɛ, ńkwɛ́ ntàb ye.
en: Israel set out again and pitched his tent beyond the Tower of Eder.

ngiemboon: Á laa fʉ̀ʼ gie Yakwɔ̂b la ne ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ wɔɔn ngwòŋ, Lẅímbèŋ gʉa, ńnuŋe Mbila gẅie à laa mágàb tá we. Ńnuŋe yé púʼu, Yakwɔ̂b júʼ.
en: While Israel was living in that region, Reuben went in and slept with his father’s concubine Bilhah, and Israel heard about it.

ngiemboon: Egubé yembàŋa gie pɔ́ Léyà la zyé é yɔɔn: Wɔɔn Lẅímbèŋ múɔ letwó we, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Simeyoŋ, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Lěvî, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Yúndà, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Esakaa ńgÿo Zambuloŋ.
en: Leah’s sons were Reuben (Jacob’s firstborn),

ngiemboon: Penkʉ́ pembàŋa pie pɔ́ Lǎshÿɛ̂ la zyé é pɔ́ɔn: wɔɔn Yesyɛ̂b ńgÿo Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ.
en: Rachel’s sons were

ngiemboon: Egubé yembàŋa gie pɔ́ Mbila ngàŋafàʼ Lǎshÿɛ̂ la zyé é yɔɔn: wɔɔn Ndaŋ ńgÿo Nɛbtali.
en: The sons of Rachel’s slave Bilhah

ngiemboon: Penkʉ́ pembàŋa pie pɔ́ Zilépà ngàŋafàʼ Léyà la zyé e pɔɔn: wɔɔn Ngâd ńgÿo Ashÿɛ̂ɛ. Pɔɔn pú ńdɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ penkʉ́ pembàŋa Yakwɔ̂b pie à la zyé kwòŋo Alam.
en: The sons of Leah’s slave Zilpah

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b la gʉa tà ńkúu lejʉ́ŋ tá we Ésàg, á Mamlé, á tsɛ̀ɛ pàga láʼa Kiliyad-Alemba gie mé gíŋe ńtóŋ lê Embeloŋ, á jʉʼ gie Ábalaham pɔ́ Ésàg la tsẅé wó, ńgwɔ́ pakÿoláʼ.
en: Jacob came to his father Isaac at Mamre   in Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron  # 35:27 Jos 14:15), where Abraham and Isaac had stayed.

ngiemboon: Ésàg la tsẅé ndùm njÿó ngùʼ móm lefɔ̌ɔn nzèm nkÿo;
en: Isaac lived 180 years.

ngiemboon: Ńgwaa kwé gʉa tsɛ́ pamángʉanjʉʼ pé púʼu, mbà à zyě ńgyá njÿó. Ezagẅi pɔ́ Yakwɔ̂b pie ée penkʉ́ pé, é túŋo yé.
en: He took his last breath and died, and was gathered to his people,   old and full of days. His sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
